sentence.Network_en: In some countries, iron fortification of foods is carried out to reduce iron deficiency.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些国家在食品中添加铁强化剂，以缓解人体缺铁。

sentence.Network_en: The researchers concluded that the fortification did not produce the increase.
sentence.Network_cn: 研究人员得出结论,认为增添铁盐不能造成血红蛋白的增高.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via French from late Latin fortificatio(n-), from fortificare (see fortify)

entry.def: Fortifications are buildings, walls, or ditches that are built to protect a place and make it more difficult to attack.

example.ex: The government has started building fortifications along its eastern border.
example.tran: 政府已经开始沿东部边境修筑防御工事。

means.word_mean: 1. defensive structure consisting of walls or mounds built around a stronghold to strengthen it
2. the art or science of strengthening defenses
3. the addition of an ingredient for the purpose of enrichment (as the addition of alcohol to wine or the addition of vitamins to food)

sentences.en: The fortifications were out of repair.
